name: Jira
description: Lookup Jira issues by key or search across Jira issues by IP, domain, email, hash, url, or CVE

options.name: Jira API URL
options.description: URL used to access the REST API of your Jira instance. For Jira Cloud this will typically be `https://<your-jira-instance>.atlassian.net`. This option must be set to "Users can view only" or "Users can view and edit".

options.name: Jira Application URL
options.description: URL used to access your Jira web application instance. Leave blank if your Application URL is the same as your API URL.  Jira Cloud users can leave this option blank. This option must be set to "Users can view only" or "Users can view and edit".

options.name: Jira Email Address
options.description: Email address used for individual to access Jira.  Only required when authenticating to Jira Cloud.

options.name: API Token
options.description: Jira API token.  Required for both Jira Cloud and Jira Server.

options.name: Projects to Search
options.description: A comma delimited list of project names to search.  Project short names can be used in addition to the long names.  Project names are not case-sensitive. If no value is provided, all accessible projects will be searched.  This setting does not affect searches on Jira Issue Keys and is only used for searches on other entities (e.g., IP, domain, cve, etc.).

options.name: Ignored Entities List
options.description: A comma delimited list entities you wish to ignore from search

options.name: Ignore Regex Entities List
options.description: A comma delimited list regular expressions for ignoring entities from search
